pageContext.claim: “Most of them should start with the word China because that's where it came from. They have a word -- Corona right? The Coronavirus. Well I said, 'What is this a place in Italy? Sounds like an island in Italy.'. Corona, no, I don't want it, it's the China, it's the China virus, that's what it is.”
pageContext.analysis: The word ‘coronavirus’ refers to the type of virus — not the specific virus that causes the disease known as covid-19. It derives its name from the virus’s crown-like shape. (Corona is the Latin word for crown.)
